website_summaries.verdict: A great STEM kit that teaches kids cause-and-effect, problem solving, and more while they build fun circuitry projects.
pros: Color-coded instructions help kids build 20 electronics projects
Projects light up, beep, and spin
Beginner kit has additional safety precautions that older kits don't
Besides STEM skills, helps kids learn to follow directions and solve problems
cons: Three AA batteries are needed to power the kit but are not included

customer_reviews.title: Draw in those bright little biys and girls
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little set to see if my class could handle it or even wanted to try it out. The response was overwhelming. They were begging me to have a turn building the projects. One of my very difficult kids not only blew threw all twenty projects and wanted to start diagramming his own, he was working with other students in a positive way. I can't wait to get my next set.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Quality fun!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the six-year-old who was previously dismantling toys and anything that had wires in order to manufacture his own creations! No wires or instructions to read, just follow the pictures or experiment on your own. No wires to connect, solidly built pieces just snap on. Two switches (1 flip, one push button), three things that light up, blades that twirl, and a piece that has sound. 21 combinations to build. Gave it to him yesterday morning and he could hardly stop to eat at mealtimes. Played with it again today. Will definitely purchase companion sets in th future.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best $15 I’ve spent on a toy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a very early introduction to electricity for our 3 year old. There are just enough pieces to make it interesting, without being overwhelming. The cool light-up features & moving parts dazzled him & still hold his interest after a few weeks. The pieces are sturdy enough for him to play with. I like the picture directions, allowing young pre-reader kids to put it together independently - my kid is still a bit young for this, but I think a 4 or 5 year old would do great. Highly recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy O

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's a Great learning tool for kids who want to know how things work! This was a gift for my 5 year old Grandson and he loves it. I only sat down with him to show him how to go thru the parts list and how to identify those parts, then explained the first project and OFF he went! He made 9 projects in less than 15 minutes all On his own and his face would lit up with every finished project! This Beginner kit comes with 21 different projects and they are geared towards developing the kids knowledge and skills. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Honestly

customer_reviews.title: 5 y/o immediately loved this thing
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews, but my 3.5 y/o immediately loved this thing...especially the light up motor fan. Its is exactly what I wanted, he's starting to understand that things need batteries, and how power flows from batteries to those things...basic problem solving, engineering, etc. I'm seriously considering getting the most souped up kit they have now, so I don't buy multiple different kits over time.
customer_reviews.author: R. M.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome toy, my daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome toy, my daughter loves it. She received it for Christmas today and unfortunately, right out the box, the peice pictured (D10) isn't working. I'm sure it's the internal wiring but there is no way to access it. This peice is a light for the egg, pretty much the whole reason we chose this particular set, she loves eggs. :(
customer_reviews.author: PV

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical about buying this for a five year old but I figured I would give it a shot. It turned out to be a great gift for my five year old grandson, and his sister at three was able to do some basic stuff with supervision (her choice - I did not push this on her). After two sessions with me, they were able to go through the instructions by themselves. While we worked on the kit together, I was able to talk some basics to the five year old (!!!) concerning circuits and switches (and one-way LEDS). Almost unbelievable, but the gospel truth. I highly recommend this kit!
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner set
customer_reviews.text: Have had about 4 months; purchased for 6yo grandson. I homeschool him and wanted a fun, engaging "brain break" exercise to introduce into our day. Day 1 - In the time it took me to read the directions and get an understanding of how to build the circuits, the kiddo had already done the first exercise. Little stinker. He still has fun with it and we've purchased addt'l kits to build onto it.
customer_reviews.author: McGaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM toy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 6 year old boy for Christmas at the recommendation of a friend. This is a great toy that promotes hands on learning about science. My son loves playing with it and tries to rework the pieces to make his own circuits. The company also has great customer service. The spinning fan stopped working after a few months and that was his favorite piece. I went to the company's website and they will send you replacement pieces for free (took about a week or so). I am planning on getting the larger versions of this as he gets older.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: One of the best buys for my son!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old son who is a budding engineer and loved all things robotics, electrical, and building. It is a great little kit and depsite the fact that he can't read yet, my 5 year old son worked through all 21 builds almost completely by himself in one day. He literally wouldn't put it down. He still goes back to it too! I bought a "skills building kit" to add to it and he loves it too! I think these are awesome and a great value for all the fun and learning included. I will be buying these for gifts for other kids in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Carter

customer_reviews.title: Now this is a teaching tool...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that my 5 year old Nephew could use this kit by himself. Was I wrong. The way that the teaching book diagrams each project allows the child to visually see how each piece is installed. The ease of installation of each piece gave him the confidence to experiment in each project. After working with my Nephew on a couple of projects, he was ready to tackle the rest of the projects himself. The pride and sense of accomplishment he experienced was priceless. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie A. Hawa

customer_reviews.title: Fan stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. I was going to save one for possible gift later. However, the fan stopped working on the first one after first use. It was even tested on full charge batteries. I searched and found a few mentions of the same issue in reviews. Oh well, I hope the other one works fine. Kids really like playing with it. Too young to understand current and all, but at least they are interested. Will report back on the second set later.
customer_reviews.author: Status Kuo

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw - broken within an hour
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine STEM toy. It does have a flaw - the EGG. When you install the egg on the LED (which looked cool BTW), the egg acts like a huge lever on the two tiny wires that connects the diode. Whatever you do to the egg, say pushing it, pulling it, twisting it, etc., even with the lightest touch, will notably bend the wires. I tried to keep my 4 year old from touching the egg as much as I can but still, within one hour the LED is snapped off. This is clearly a design flaw - the base of the LED should have been sandwiched between two plastic pieces, rather than mounted on the top surface.
customer_reviews.author: Chi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure he'll enjoy the concept for a couple of ...
customer_reviews.text: Of course we opened it and played with it before wrapping it! It's a gift for my almost five year old grandson. Pretty sure he'll enjoy the concept for a couple of weeks or at least until he loses one or two of the components. Hey, that could be a suggestion - the base board could be combined with a storage unit for all of the pieces! Just a thought!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Suprenant

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm truly enamored that such a product exists. I've been getting into electronics myself, and was hoping that I could introduce my 4 year old nephew to STEM. He has yet to play with it, but I think he'll really like it, probably think it's magic or something. One reviewer noted that they wished the pieces were transparent to see the wiring underneath, I agree with that as well, but it's only a small gripe. Also, I wish there was an explanation of how each project works so that I could explain it to my nephew the best I could, in the very likely case that he might. Again, however, another small gripe for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous and intelligent gift for a child as an introduction to electricity! I purchased it for my 5 year old grandson and he is fascinated with it. Step by step experiments are well presented and simple to follow in the instruction booklet. Sturdy and well made. A GREAT value for money product, I look forward to buying the more advanced kits as he gets older. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Hyland

customer_reviews.title: Love it. My son really loves it but one ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My son really loves it but one of the pieces, the red/yellow light piece, was broken and there is no way I guess to just get a replacement part. Now we have to return it. COuldn't find contact seller area for replacement part question. Very sad to return it. Wish is wouldn't have arrived broken. All other parts work great, but without the other light we are limited as to the number of activities we can do and can't use the egg either.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: 2 Components failed, still cool toy
customer_reviews.text: The beeper and lights in the fan broke within hours of opening this toy. Quality of the components is pretty poor, but the value of snapping together and learning the concept of the electricity is valuable.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Becker

customer_reviews.title: Better than playing phone and video games all day...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome learning tool. Bought one set each for two of my grandkids, ages 8 and 6. Once they got familiar with the parts and drawings, they were off and running. One set had a propeller light that didn't work, but I went to the seller's website to order a replacement...which was very straightforward. Looking into some of their more advanced sets now...
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter likes science so.....
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Snap Circuit set I have purchased. Granddaughter has put together several of the electrical experiments. She was bummed that the lie detector said she was not truthful even when she correctly gave her name. Maybe she has sweaty hands that fools the sensor? Regardless, she likes this set. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JDDD

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for my 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for christmas, & he absolutely loved it. He has played with it many times since then. The light up fan is really cool! They have a book of different circuits you can build that do different things with the special light, sound, and fan pieces. He doesn't even need my assistance its awesome. Now I'm looking for a more advanced one for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Easy, rewarding toy
customer_reviews.text: These snap circuits are so easy to use, with such obvious measures of success. My 4 year old loves her set. She only had to be helped the first few times, and now she confident enough to create on her own. They genuinely interest her, and have kept her interest for a few weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exciting for Kindergarten
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my STEM-excited Kindergartner. He has had so much fun discovering how electricity works and experimenting. I'm excited to get him the bigger sets for his birthday. My only wish is that they came with a booklet that parents could read to explain the science to the little scientists.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My nephew couldn't stop!
customer_reviews.text: This electronics kit includes 101 projects. My 9 year old nephew finished them all in about 2 days. He was determined to complete it! What a whiz kid. The kit itself is well built and the cost was super affordable for the amount of learning he got out of it. Highly recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great fun and great learning!
customer_reviews.text: We got this years ago and every time I get it out I’m so pleased with how much my kids enjoy playing with it. It’s so easy to use and easy to manipulate that they are learning and don’t even realize it. Excellent quality and it’s very safe. My kids are 9, 7 and 5 and they all love it!
customer_reviews.author: Saramelizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Nephew loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My three, going on four, year old nephew loves this! He's not really into following patterns yet, but he has a lot of fun just doing his own thing. It won't be long until the patterns are fun, too. This is perfect for littles to learn the concepts of a circuit board.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More like 10 different circuts not 20
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and comes with good directions, however doesn't come with all the parts that it lists in the instructions. The instructions state that however why give directions for something that can't be done with the pieces given? Had over 20 different types in the instructions but could only do maybe half that
customer_reviews.author: Billy caprio

customer_reviews.title: For small kids 4-6
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my small when we turned 7. He didn't open it until we was almost 8. It missed a piece. It was one of the blue extension pieces. He wasn't too impressed with it. I should've opened it earlier so I can have a return for the missing piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This stem product I bought as a gift for my 9 year old boy. He plays with this for hours. There are multiple ways he can design this and he is just absolutely in awe over it. So am I! This product is amazing and great hands on for an older child. 100% reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for young minds!
customer_reviews.text: My son is four and a half years old and he absolutely loves this toy. He was so excited that he finished all the circuits in less than an hour with my help. Now he spends hours playing with these. The only complaint i have is that the horn sounds awful!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Set
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 11 year old son and he really likes this. I looked at several before deciding to go with this one. I wasn't sure if he would like it and didn't want to spend a lot of money on something he might not like. After seeing his excitement when putting the different designs together for this, I will definitely be getting him an upgrade soon!
customer_reviews.author: GenC

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to spark interest in my nephews. The oldest, 7yo, plays with it every time he comes to visit. My husband had to help him understand it at first, but now he can do it on his own. May need to get him a bigger set in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Hipichk

customer_reviews.title: Great for little engineers!
customer_reviews.text: Our six year old received this as a Christmas gift a week ago. He LOVES it! He was so excited to use it! He was able to zoom through all the building options in about 20 minutes. Now, we’re looking for a more advanced set! Haha!
customer_reviews.author: miayercat

customer_reviews.title: My son liked it too so I purchased this one a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a different set for my daughter (10) for her birthday. My son liked it too so I purchased this one a few weeks later for his birthday (8). Their STEM teacher had recommended them. They love them and they are great educational toy.
customer_reviews.author: RaMiller

customer_reviews.title: Big hit!
customer_reviews.text: We just opened the Snap circuits box today and it’s a huge hit with my 5 year old son! He’s totally not interested in looking at the diagrams, so hopefully he won’t break it. And he’s been snapping for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A cool toy to learn.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool toy. My kids were interested for maybe an hour or two and definitely did learn the basics of a circuit. I think of this more like a project that will be done one or maybe two times.
customer_reviews.author: Maester

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to opening this product I bought my son for the holidays. Unfortunately, the battery pack for this product was misassembled (see pic) and therefore, it was useless. Unfortunately, I am beyond the window to return this product. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great activity for kids who like to build
customer_reviews.text: Love snap circuits. Bought this for my 7-year old nephew as a starter set. He took it out of the box and played with it for HOURS and HOURS during his visit. His parents are planning to buy him more sets to add on.
customer_reviews.author: busy mom

customer_reviews.title: Educational and my son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this kit. We built everything the first time together, then he would start to get creative and build on his own. He still likes to play with it and has learned how to flip the fan so there are no lights on during the day, but lights up at night. It was a great first learning kit. I plan on buying other kits to add on to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hessler

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for your science lover kid . Not hours, but days of fun and engagement. My kid just love it , so many ways to make your circuit not only from the instructions but he used his own imagination too.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan A.

customer_reviews.title: Kids prefer it over TV
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the kids, they love it. Actually winning over tv which I think speaks volumes. They like experimenting and are getting a good idea of how circuits and electricity work. They snaps are pretty genius way to get young kids involved with electronics.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lima

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Received as gift for 5 year old. My child loved enough we bought one for a friend. Lots of options and is one my kid actually gets out to play with on a semi-regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: aaa35

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son loves this! It has kept him busy for over an hour. We have about the same level understanding on how it works though. All we know is we connect things and they light up!
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Maid

customer_reviews.title: ... granddaughter was so excited to get this and can easily follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old granddaughter was so excited to get this and can easily follow the instructions. She was introduced to the circuit sets when her 7 year old brother got the 100 project set. He wasnt too keen on allowing her to use the set. This simple beginners set was just what she needed.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The box came with a missing piece but I contacted the company and they sent it right out to me. Great customer service! My 7 year old son loves it and can do it mostly by himself with little adult help.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tarbox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a gift for my 5-year old nephew. As soon as he unwrapped it he opened it to start playing. He absolutely loved it, and has already learned so much. We will be ordering the bigger packs shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: My five year-old grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: My grandson used these at preschool so we bought him a set for home. Our daughter says that he loves to play with the circuits and to build things.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: my 6 year old loves this. after we did a few together he got the hang of it and works them by himself now. he likes to figure out how to make things work on it without the instructions too. easy to use and educational
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for a tiny tinkerer
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old tinkerer loves this kit. Directions are picture and written so after the first few times of me helping him he can figure it out on his own know.
customer_reviews.author: melissa davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3 1/2 year old nephew for Christmas. I guess he loves it! I know he is a little young, but he is a bright kid for his age and my sister in law is asking that I get him more for his birthday! It sounds like he enjoys it, and it is pretty easy for him to use. This is a great way to teach kids basic electronics in a safe and constructive way! I will be a long time customer for sure (:
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. Great way to get the mind going. Great way for adults to learn electrical basics also.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Limited for a 7/8 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 yr old grandson. He put it together in minutes and was excited first but would have loved a more advanced version perhaps
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it for a few hours
customer_reviews.text: My six-year-old son loved this. Unfortunately, many pieces broke after just 3-4 hours of play. The sound piece stopped making noise, the spinning lights stopped working, and the red-yellow light bulb broke off. It is really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old. He loves it. He was able to do all the projects by himself without any help. Great intro into circuits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super cool!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old son loves this! I had to help him a bit put it together, but once he got the hang of it- he tried many different configurations. This is super cool and a learning toy. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing toy, apart from the easily burned W1 horn unit
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyable and piques my 5YO’s interest, however in just the first hour of play, the W1 horn unit already got burnt.
customer_reviews.author: Avia

customer_reviews.title: Makes learning fun!
customer_reviews.text: My six year old nephew loves this!!! I will definitely get one for his cousin and an expansion pack for my nephew! It’s so easy for him to assemble, and he is definitely learning! It’s also dusting off a few cobwebs for me!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: IT is easy to set up and provides lots of learning and ...
customer_reviews.text: Our four-year old grandson adores this set! IT is easy to set up and provides lots of learning and fun! It can light up different ways, makes noises, and then by moving parts, it changes. The piece de resistance is when it is snapped to making swirling lights of color- like fireworks, almost. It's really interesting and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Garnett Grad

customer_reviews.title: Snap circuits ALWAYS wins!
customer_reviews.text: I buy several Snap circuits packs monthly to give as birthday presents. They're great! Educational and fun! I will continue to buy from Amazon. I can't find them locally. I give them to girls especially. Building our budding engineers.
customer_reviews.author: dhead

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for teaching electronics to young kids.
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these over the year for grandkids and work with them to explain what they are building and why it works. I just wish the manufacturer would give more details as to what the parts do and why they are important.
customer_reviews.author: areviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 6 yr old son. He loves it. My husband had just as much fun as my son. It’s a great way to get kids interested in stem in a simple way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandsons loved this.
customer_reviews.text: The grandsons, ages 3 & 5, loved the Electronics Kit! Papa is an engineer so had a blast working with the boys on this. The yellow snap piece that controls the light bulb did blow within 15 mins after opening the game. Not sure if it was something we did.. I am trying to find out if replacement parts are available. Would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Duhaime

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my grandson on his 5th birthday
customer_reviews.text: He loves it! Probably doesn't get as much play time as his Lego sets, but it is a great purchase! I will be getting this again for other little family members who love building and tinkering.
customer_reviews.author: Reads For Fun

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The connection where you put the egg on top broke and stuck inside the egg. Not very durable
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Le

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr olds put all the “machines “together in one day. Definitely investing in add ons. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Multiples

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these and spend hours making and creating new ones. Great buy highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ddemory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for our 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: This is so much fun and requires just the right amount of patience from our 5 year old boy. He really enjoys working through the installation and seeing a working product at the end.
customer_reviews.author: ECOrlando22

customer_reviews.title: stop reading, buy now!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old absolutely love this. After a few minutes working with him to understand the basic functions and how to interpret the manual, he's able to put all the experiments together without adult help. He's learning how to fix them and to make his own designs, too. We've bought a few of the other sets based on our experience with this one. Quite possibly the best thing I've ever bought him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super gift for the young electrical engineer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson on his 6th birthday. He loved it so much he wouldn't put it down.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a six year old who is curious about electronic. Arrived on time and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A Moses

customer_reviews.title: Great for kiddos
customer_reviews.text: Have to definitely have parental help especially with the younger kids. My granddaughter loves it. Gives her special time with Daddy. Great learning game.
customer_reviews.author: Emmie Annetta

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous toy
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous toy. Great for little ones just learning. Our four year old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kandy Kay Scaramuzzo

customer_reviews.title: Nice engineering beginners toy
customer_reviews.text: I must say for the price , excellent , also super fast shipping to NYC which is kind of hard nowadays even using prime .
customer_reviews.author: j encarnacion

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old grandson loves this!
customer_reviews.text: It was a huge hit with my 5 year old grandson. It is easy to use, put together and my grandson loves that he can make it light up, make noise and it has a fan that spins.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Richardson

customer_reviews.title: This is by far his favorite Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our 4yo grandson that goes to Montessori. This is by far his favorite Christmas gift. We started out doing with him, but by Day 2 he has played with so much, that he can now do most on his own. I highly recommend this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The piece the egg is connected to broke on first use. Would love to have it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Pollio

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old absolutely loves this. He can follow the diagrams with a little help, but also enjoys just playing around with it to see what works. He has managed to break the fan twice , but I have easily fixed it both times. Played with it all day and picked it up immediately the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: k...at

customer_reviews.title: Kids won't stop playing..
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love building circuits together. This was an amazing investment.
customer_reviews.author: Sailorette

customer_reviews.title: He plays for hours.
customer_reviews.text: Grandson started to play with it before opening other gifts.
customer_reviews.author: pmc

customer_reviews.title: Defective parts
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Xmas, my son was so excited but two of the pieces didn’t work. Disappointed. Very cool concept, too bad it was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Midwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant gift for granddaughter!
customer_reviews.text: She loved this and her dad loved that I got it for her amidst all the pinky purple frilly stuff :)
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jayden

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Have bought 2 as gifts for 7 year olds. Both LOVE this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Great idea needing some tweaking!
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year-old niece LOVED this gift. Unfortunately, after one trip through the book two of the pieces no longer worked. If you are rating this for 5+, the pieces need to be sturdy enough for little hands to snap them on and off repeatedly without the wiring coming lose. I’m undecided,now, whether to purchase the larger set for her birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Big hit for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for Christmas gifts for our 3 grandsons, ages 6, 8 and 11 years old. They all played with them all day. They were a big hit with everyone. Their Dad is a teacher and he was impressed with how much learning was going on in the play. I will be buying more kits in the future to add to the fun.
customer_reviews.author: Julee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent developmental toy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product was a big hit on Christmas. This was recommended on my town's PTA page as a great developmental tool for my child. He does require some assistance to operate it (he's 6) but he's interested and excited to make the circuits do each trick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works really well. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Speaker Smokes
customer_reviews.text: Received this product today and after one hour of play, the speaker started smoking on the unit. Very disappointed as my son was excited to get many uses out of this Snap Circuit. This happened 6 months ago with another Snap Circuit we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for 5 yr old
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son's birthday. He loves puzzles and has worked through several of the projects in the book. I love that the projects have picture instructions and an easy grid for him to follow. We will be getting the next level set for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: BoomKat

customer_reviews.title: This is a great way to introduce young children to STEM
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to introduce young children to STEM. The pieces are all numbered and the instructions are easy enough to follow that if your child can't completely read yet, they can still follow along. My 5 year old daughter loves playing with these and gets excited when the project works. The horn is a little annoying though.
customer_reviews.author: Book Hound

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM intro toy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our 6 year old! Instructions are basic much like Legos and he can play mostly unassisted.
customer_reviews.author: Linz

customer_reviews.title: Big hit with my 4 yr old Nephew
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is obsessed with electricity and lights. He is 4, almost 5, and I knew he would love something like this for Christmas. So glad I found this! The first time he got this out of the box, he didn’t stop building circuits for 5 hours. It’s official— he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this. After some initial practice with a parent, he can now put it together independently.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Very good toy for the kids, keeps them engaged. Excellent unit to start from.
customer_reviews.author: KShop

customer_reviews.title: Something different
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t know the kid would like this toy so much. May buy more as a gift for others.
customer_reviews.author: AprilSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Really fun and way for kids to learn about electricity
customer_reviews.text: Really fun and way for kids to learn about electricity. Our 6 year old can play with it for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured, but ;;
customer_reviews.text: I have an Autistic son. This was the absolute perfect gift for him. He loves tinkering with it & trying different things. However, I was disappointed that it was not as pictured, but my son loved it anyway
customer_reviews.author: Richlee007

customer_reviews.title: i wish more of the pieces were transparent so my ...
customer_reviews.text: i wish more of the pieces were transparent so my D could see the wiring but she likes it and we have been able to explore circuits.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Learning lots & durable STEM toy!
customer_reviews.text: I love Snap Circuits! Durable & my grandkids age 2 through 10 have a blast building the projects, & they are learning!!
customer_reviews.author: WallaceWorld

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves to put this together with us!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Great circuit activity!
customer_reviews.text: My son loved building this. Perfect for a 9-10 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Wheeler

product_meta.title: Snap Circuits Beginner, Electronics Exploration Kit, Stem Kit For Ages 5-9 (SCB-20)
product_meta.description: "Snap circuit’s beginner STEM kit includes 14 parts, and more than 20 projects learning the basics of how switches and circuits work. The included color manual was created just for younger ""engineers"" With few words and lots of step-by-step diagrams. Parts have extra safety features integrated beyond the circuits technology, included in every snap circuit set.these STEM building sets are an excellent introduction to problem-solving, following directions, and the satisfaction of A job well done. Snap Circuits beginner is one of the award-winning lines of Snap Circuits from Elena electronics. Perfect for young engineers ages 5-9.requires 3 “AA” batteries, not included.snap circuit products were created to provide a fundamental, hands-on education in how electrical circuits work to run everyday devices. All parts mount on plastic modules that snap together with ease. Young engineers will have hours of educational fun learning about electronics and how to build circuits. The circuit safe patented safety device (unique to Snap Circuits branded products) makes learning circuitry safe.snap circuits products have won many awards, including toy of the year (toty), Austria's best toys for kids, parent's Choice Recommended, good housekeeping's best toy, family choice, National Parenting publications awards (Nappa gold), children's choice, Dr. Toy (100 best children's products, 10 best educational products, Green toy company), the inaugural seriously STEM award & Kapi award.snap circuits is endorsed by Educators worldwide and used in schools, libraries, museums, and stem programs."
feature_bullets: Snap circuit’s beginner has 14 parts to build over 20 projects.
These STEM activities are a wonderful introduction to problem solving, following directions, and the satisfaction of a job well done.
The color manual makes it easy-to-follow for all builders.
One of the award winning Snap Circuits line of electronic exploration kits.
Extra safety features for younger engineers, perfect for ages 5-9.
